Prerequisites: COMPLETION OF ALL LOWER DIVISION COURSEWORK; ACG 4111
Course Description: PRESENTS STANDARDS AND PROCEDURES OF AUDITING FINANCIAL INFORMATION, ETHICS AND RESPONSIBILITIES OF AUDITORS, PLANNING, COLLECTION AND DOCUMENTATION OF AUDIT EVIDENCE, REPORTING AND AUDITING STANDARDS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
UPON COMPLETION OF THIS COURSE, STUDENTS ARE ABLE TO:
1.  PLAN AN ENGAGEMENT
2.  EVALUATE A CLIENT AND ENGAGEMENT
3.  UNDERSTAND BASIC CONCEPTS OF INTERNAL CONTROLS IN BOTH A MANUAL AND COMPUTERIZED ENVIRONMENT
4.  OBTAIN, DOCUMENT AND EVALUATE AUDIT INFORMATION
5.  PREPARE VARIOUS FORMS OF AUDIT COMMUNICATION
6.  IMPROVE RESEARCH, ORAL AND WRITTEN COMMUNICATION SKILLS
7.  REINFORCE ETHICAL AND PROFESSIONAL BUSINESS CONDUCT
Textbook(s): AUDITING AND ASSURANCE SERVICES, PEARSON PRENTICE HALL
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
